input_text:
Job Title: Mechanical Designer

Location: De Pere, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Job Description:Explore an opportunity with Washworld, Inc.! Join a pioneer in automatic vehicle wash equipment as a Mechanical Designer!
Are you ready to play a pivotal role in an exciting industry? At Washworld, Inc., we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be a driving force behind innovation and vehicle wash excellence.
Why Washworld, Inc.?Legacy of Excellence: Join a legacy of more than 25 years of excellence in the industry. We're known for our top-tier products and unmatched customer support, all driven by our dedicated team.Real Impact: As a Mechanical Designer, you'll be on the cutting edge of vehicle wash technology. You will be responsible for designing both new products and product enhancements built around customer needs and exceptional customer care during and after the sale.Innovative Environment: Embrace a culture that thrives on innovation. You'll be influencing the design evolution of our vehicle wash equipment.Collaborative Journey: Cruise alongside a team of awesome individuals who share your dedication. 
More about what your day-to-day may look like:Facilitate the design of new products for vehicle wash equipment.Support engineering changes made to existing vehicle wash equipment. Collaborate with Technical Service Representatives:to ensure customer feedback is included in product developmentto educate the Technical Service Representatives on releases and upgradesWork on the creation and assembly of prototypes to validate design concepts and functionality.Manage costing and deadlines associated with new designs.Develop 3D models and 2D drawings that accurately represent the design specifications.  Develop documentation for our manuals, sales literature, training program, and website.  Choose appropriate components based on project requirements, functionality, and reliability.  Collaborate with suppliers to source components that meet design specifications and quality standards.Coordinate in-house and field testing of vehicle wash equipment.Analyze RMA (warranty) data to identify trends associated with component issues.
Reports To:Razor Product Manager
QualificationsChampioning attitude regarding customer service Ability to effectively manage and prioritize projects Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel Comfortable interacting directly with customers and suppliers Minimum 3 years Mechanical Design experience Solid model and 2D drawing software experience Associate degree in Mechanical Design or similar degree

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Mechanical Designer
output_json.summary: Join Washworld, Inc., a pioneer in automatic vehicle wash equipment, as a Mechanical Designer.
optional_skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel
Comfortable interacting directly with customers and suppliers
soft_skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable interacting directly with customers and suppliers
job_responsibilities: Facilitate the design of new products for vehicle wash equipment.
Support engineering changes made to existing vehicle wash equipment.
Collaborate with Technical Service Representatives to ensure customer feedback is included in product development.
Educate the Technical Service Representatives on releases and upgrades.
Work on the creation and assembly of prototypes to validate design concepts and functionality.
Manage costing and deadlines associated with new designs.
Develop 3D models and 2D drawings that accurately represent the design specifications.
Develop documentation for manuals, sales literature, training program, and website.
Choose appropriate components based on project requirements, functionality, and reliability.
Collaborate with suppliers to source components that meet design specifications and quality standards.
Coordinate in-house and field testing of vehicle wash equipment.
Analyze RMA data to identify trends associated with component issues.
output_json.company_information: Washworld, Inc. is a legacy of more than 25 years in the industry, known for top-tier products and unmatched customer support.

other.content: Championing attitude regarding customer service Ability to effectively manage and prioritize projects Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel Comfortable interacting directly with customers and suppliers Minimum 3 years Mechanical Design experience Solid model and 2D drawing software experience Associate degree in Mechanical Design or similar degree
